result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank C Shook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:01 PM Defendant, Frank C Shook, appeared. Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Marissa Fredrickson appeared. All parties appeared by video Zoom. Status of probation discussed. Defendant still owes restitution and court obligations. Defendant has been consistent on his payments. State requested another extension of probation with possibility of early discharge if paid in full. Agent requested a civil judgment. Court extended probation for 1 year or until the restitution obligation is paid in full, whichever comes first. Agent to send order for Judge to sign. 2:16 PM

DPA Motion to show cause filed by DA Jane Kohlwey

Defendant, Frank C Shook, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is also present. DA Kohlwey objected to change in restitution, stated defendant has only pay $60. Request for DPA be extended for additional six months beyond its end date in November. Defendant made statement regarding collection coming after him. Court stated that does not pertain to the restitution matter. Court denied defendant's motion. State will file motion for extension of DPA. 1:30/1:53 p.m.
Motion hearing on May 11, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant requests restitution dropped due to his ex-wife filing Chapter 7.

ADA William Appleton appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person pro se.  Court states purpose is to revoke deferred prosecution agreement.  Domestic violence program has been completed and address is correct.  ADA Appleton requests time for defendant to submit proof of completion. Court instructed Proof of completion  go to District Attorney office.  ADA Appleton would not recommend revocation of DPA if proof provided.  If DV treatment continued but monthly reports are lacking and not able to be recreated, court would consider agreement  for extension of DPA to match missing reports.  Proof to be to DA office by 2-9-18.  Defendant requests modification to restitution.  Defendant to discuss matter with ADA Appleton.  If that matter is to be considered by court,  Motion to be filed.

Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $5,290.21 plus surcharge for a total of $5,819.23.

Defendant Frank C Shook in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF37 and 16CF64.  Rights/Elements. In 16CF37, Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 3,4, & 5 with domestic enhancers dismissed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1 & 2 Dismissed but read in. On Cts. 3, & 5 Domestic enhancers dismissed, Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample.  Domestic abuse counseling.  Restitution of $5819.23.  Ct. 3 $443.00 costs.  Ct. 5 $243.00 costs.  Ct. 4  Domestic enhancer dismissed.  Court withheld adjudication, and approved and entered into the DPA for 24 months. 3 days credit.  16CF64 Dismissed but read in.
